title: Borsao 2014 Garnacha (Campo de Borja)
description: Untamed plum and cherry aromas are a bit strained. This everyday Garnacha is fresh and fruity in feel, with good but standard plum and cherry flavors. An edgy grating finish with a spot of oak character wraps this up.

title: Henry Estate 2014 Pinot Gris (Umpqua Valley)
description: On the plus side, this is a well-ripened, full-bodied wine, with a mix of pear and citrus. It's lightly spicy and drinking at its peak, broad and just a little flat on the palate.

title: Herdade do Rocim 2014 White (Alentejano)
description: The wine is soft and lightly textured. It has fruit with ripe apricot and white peach flavors that are lifted by the bright citrus aftertaste. The wine is ready to drink.

title: Montoya 2011 Cuvée E.M.H. Reserva Garnacha (Cariñena)
description: Floral blueberry and black-currant aromas are jammy. Following the nose, this Garnacha feels chunky and low in acidity. Jammy flavors of blueberry and cassis end in a pudgy but friendly way. Drink this low-acid offering sooner rather than later.

title: Kirkland Signature 2011 Signature Series Malbec (Mendoza)
description: Stewy foresty aromas of dark berry fruits are rustic and show a hint of graphite. This is severe on the palate, with hard pinching tannins. Stalky, salty flavors of roasted black plum and blackberry finish similarly, with tannic bite.

title: Otazu 2014 Chardonnay (Navarra)
description: A simple bouquet offers light apple and melon aromas, while the palate shows some malic acidity before it softens. Melon, apple and a touch of butter work together to create a mild flavor profile, while this is mellow and short on the finish.

title: Folin Cellars 2012 Petite Sirah (Rogue Valley)
description: This has a lively, albeit unconventional entry, with aromatics conjuring up gingersnap cookies. Coffee, blackberry and a potent whiff of barnyard take over, the earthy flavors muting the fruit.

title: Mahonia 2014 Rosé of Pinot Noir Rosé (Willamette Valley)
description: Fresh and fruity, this cherry-red rosé cloaks its strawberry and raspberry fruit in a graham-cracker frame. Tart fruit flavors carry an initial impression of sweetness, but in fact this is finished dry.

title: Lagar de Besada 2013 Baladiña Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Peachy aromas are less than perky, while in the mouth this is lemony, narrow and citric. Flavors of lemon and tangerine finish with stony mineral notes but also a drawing citric acidity.

title: Silver Palm 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)
description: Jammy aromas, figgy flavors and a very smooth mouthfeel define this medium-bodied and straightforward wine. Without much of the typical tannins, it's easy on the palate.

title: Vignerons de Buxy 2013 Buissonnier  (Côte Chalonnaise)
description: This attractive, lightly honeyed wine has apple and fresh pear flavors. Fresh, fruity and crisp, it finishes with a youthful lift that suggests it will be better from mid-2016.

title: Tortoise Creek 2012 The Revivalist Merlot (Clarksburg)
description: This medium-bodied wine has aromas that suggest strawberry jam and maple syrup, and equally fruity and ripe flavors. Touches of vanilla and chocolate add a bit of unctuous complexity, and the mouthfeel is velvety.

title: Tranzind 2013 Red (Lodi)
description: Smoky, cedary aromas and flavors dominate this bold, full-bodied and tannic wine made from 80% Zinfandel with Petite Sirah, Syrah and Cabernet Sauvignon. Spicy, toasted, almost sweet flavors of oak are very apparent.

title: Cantine Sant'Agata 2014 Baby  (Barbera d'Asti)
description: Fresh and easy drinking, this informal wine opens with aromas of dark cherries, blackberries and a whiff of clove that carry over to the straightforward palate. It's straightforward but well made.

title: Cartuxa 2014 EA Branco White (Alentejano)
description: This is a friendly fruity wine that has a soft texture and bright acidity. If it does miss a sense of place, it makes up for it with citrus and white fruit flavors that are so fresh. Drink now.

title: Château Bélingard 2014 Bélingard Moelleux White (Bergerac)
description: This blend of Sémillon and Sauvignon Gris is medium dry in character, with fruity acidity and a floral character from the Sauvignon Gris. A crisp, light fruitiness makes it an attractive apéritif wine.

title: Bellacana 2013 Bellacana Vineyard Chardonnay (Alexander Valley)
description: Coconut-laden oak kicks off the entry of this wine, a crisp version of the variety that nonetheless exhibits plenty of oak characteristics and a rich ripeness of baked apple, pear and pineapple.

title: Fiuza 2014 Native Touriga Nacional-Cabernet Sauvignon (Tejo)
description: Considering both grapes in the blend are known for their tannic structure, this is ripe and open. It is fruity with red berry flavors and acidity to balance. There is a round soft aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Louis M. Martini 2012 Monte Rosso Vineyard Mountain Red (Sonoma Valley)
description: A mix of 37% Zinfandel, 32% Syrah and 31% Petite Sirah, this is a burly, thick and syrupy concoction from a high-elevation vineyard site known for its power and concentration. Sweet vanilla rides a dense wave of tannin and oak, finishing tight and leathery.

title: Louis Max 2014  Chablis
description: Fresh, light and fruity this is attractive young Chablis. It is soft, dwelling on the fruit rather than any texture. Crisp and with citrus and green apple flavors, it will be ready to drink easily by mid-2016.

title: Michael Mondavi Family Estate 2013 Isabel Mondavi Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Sharply etched in pineapple and Meyer lemon, this wine retains a brightness of fruit and acidity throughout, never overly impeded by oak. A subtle, earthy herbal streak plays in the background.

title: Monteviejo 2013 Festivo Torrontés (La Rioja)
description: This Torrontés smells round, leesy, soft and short on particular fruit aromas. Due to its age, this feels plump and low on edgy acidity. Powdery citrus and lime flavors end flat, with some burn. This is probably past its prime, but it's still in good shape to enjoy now.

title: José Maria da Fonseca 2014 Colecção Privada Roxo Rosé (Península de Setúbal)
description: A light, bright and fresh wine, the epitome of a fruity rosé, this is made from Moscatel Roxo, a pink-skinned grape. It has plenty of lively acidity, a lightly perfumed character and a final burst of red fruits.

title: Mas Igneus 2013 Barranc Dels Closos White (Priorat)
description: Nectarine and white peach aromas are pithy, pointed and briny like sea water. This feels citrusy and pulpy, while zesty citric flavors of grapefruit, scallion and green herbs finish with residual pithy briny notes.

title: Quinta do Casal Monteiro 2014 White (Tejo)
description: A smooth and ripe wine with tropical fruits as well as more crisp apple. It is ripe wine, full in the mouth with a final perfumed acidity. Give it another six months.

title: Vaza 2013  Rioja
description: Despite some grit and tar on the nose, this Rioja opens well with spicy cherry and plum aromas. A standard, mild palate is satisfactory, while lightly roasted slightly briny plum and berry flavors end with a hint of saltiness.

title: Trenel Fils 2014  Saint-Véran
description: Crisp and textured, this is a ripe wine with a core of tight structure. Fruity with its lemon and apple flavors, it has a lightly herbal edge that adds a green, fresh aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Noble Tree 2014 Grenache (Russian River Valley)
description: Granted, this is a young wine, but on first impression it imparts a raw, burly earthiness that's hard to completely embrace, with a sense of cooked mushrooms and sour cherry around soft, light-bodied tannins. Give it plenty of air.

title: Oak Knoll 2014 Unoaked Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)
description: Light green-apple fruit and gentle highlights of cinnamon are in place, though this wine feels a little flat on the palate. A quick finish brings a hint of plastic.

title: Wines & Winemakers 2014 Companhia das Lezírias Herdade de Catapereiro White (Tejo)
description: Fruity and aromatic, this blend of Fernão Pires, Arinto and Sauvignon Blanc is fresh with attractive acidity and also riper tropical fruit and pear flavors. It has a mineral texture that gives the a fine structure. Drink now.
designation: Companhia das Lezírias Herdade de Catapereiro
